attires.name: Bindi
attires.description: A decorative mark worn on the forehead, traditionally by Hindu women.

attires.name: Sindoor
attires.description: A red or orange powder applied along the parting of a married Hindu woman's hair, extending onto the forehead.

attires.name: Tilak
attires.description: A mark, often made with sandalwood paste, ash, or kumkum, applied to the forehead during religious ceremonies.

attires.name: Vibhuti (Sacred Ash)
attires.description: Sacred ash worn on the forehead by Shaivites and ascetics like Aghori, symbolizing purity and devotion.

attires.name: Maang Tikka
attires.description: A traditional hair ornament worn by Indian women, placed along the parting of the hair and resting on the forehead.
